title: Wine by Joe 2016 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: This blends forward, fleshy peach and pear flavors. It's lightly spicy, with generous acidity and an overall crisp impression that calls for near-term consumption.

title: Xanadu 2015 Exmoor Chardonnay (Margaret River)
description: Lemon, warm butter and an overripe vegetal nose lead into a toasty palate that seems overtly rich. Nevertheless, this will satisfy many a Chardonnay lover.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Organza White (Rioja)
description: Oak and spice notes are out front on the nose but not overpowering. This blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca is medium in body, with a shot of bracing acidity. Wood-dominant flavors of spiced apple and resin carry the finish.

title: Carlton Cellars 2015 Seven Devils Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a tasty, good value effort with fresh strawberry and cherry fruit flavors. Its light suggestions of toast and cocoa point to some time in barrel, as does its pleasant whiff of east Asian spice.

title: Bollig-Lehnert 2016 Piesporter Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Initial aromas of smoke and savory dried herb blow off to reveal crisp yellow peach, apple and blossom in this wine. Off-dry in style, it's crunchy and spry, with a spicy, earthen finish.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2016  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: This young wine offers bright cherry flavors as well as the structure of a proper Gevrey, giving a good combination of fruitiness and tannins. It's juicy, crisp and is likely to age relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Machorre 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This mature wine is ripe with both black fruits and secondary toast and rich mushrooms flavors. It is structured, with a dry core of tannins that gives strength to the generous character of the wine. Drink now.

title: Château Montlisse 2014  Saint-Émilion
description: Situated to the east of the village of Saint-Émilion, overlooking the Dordogne Valley, this estate has produced a ripe wine in this fruity vintage. With some solid tannins to back up the generous black fruits, it is still young, so best wait to drink until 2019.

title: Château Saint-Nicolas 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This wood-laden wine is rich in toast. The fruit is there, blackberry and juicy flavors coming through to balance the enthusiastic wood aging. It will take a while to integrate before becoming a rich, full wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2016 Indian Wells Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine's baking spice, vanilla, white flower and peach aromas are followed by sweet, full-feeling stone fruit and spice flavors that pull up short on the finish. It's a straightforward crowd-pleaser.

title: Chesebro 2015 Cedar Lane Grenache Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Very light in color, there's a yeasty quality to this bottling, with aromas of sourdough showing alongside green banana, wet sand and muddy clay. The palate picks up a brioche touch and rides a compelling chalky texture, making for a very interesting take on the grape.

title: Coniglio 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dusty red currant combines with toasty oak in this structured integrated wine that holds its ripeness with grace. Bright acidity supports the overall weight and concentration.

title: Corte Fornello 2012  Bardolino Superiore
description: Aromas of red currant, citrus and underbrush take center stage. The medium-bodied, lively palate delivers raspberry jam, orange zest and a touch of cinnamon alongside lithe tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Cusumano 2016 Alta Mora Rosato (Etna)
description: Delicate scents of Spanish broom, apple and berry mingle with a whiff of Mediterranean brush. The aromas flow over to the vibrant palate along with nectarine zest while tangy acidity and a saline note give it a mouthwatering finish.

title: Cutruzzola 2015 Riven Rock Vineyard Riesling (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Light in color, this bottling shows lemon rinds, orange blossoms, lime zest, wet concrete and the slightest hint of petrol on the nose. The flavors are very rounded and botanical in nature, with gin-like touches of lime skin, apple blossom and a sweet juniper touch. It offers great tension and acid.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2015 Grand Assemblage Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Young and showing tart cranberry and raspberry flavors, this softens on the midpalate then leans into a chocolate marshmallow finish. It's a bit muddled but offers a lot of interesting flavors.

title: Domaine Changarnier 2015  Monthélie
description: From young vines, this soft, fruity wine offers a happy mix of citrus and apple fruits giving a crisp texture. A touch of toast comes from wood aging. Drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine Chopin et Fils 2015 Bas de Combe  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: This wine has plenty of tannins, although they are embedded in ripe, juicy red fruits. This village wine has a solid core as well as bright acidity, offering the potential for aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Bulgariana 2016 Rosé (Thracian Valley)
description: This brilliant pink rosé from Bulgaria has aromas of citrus blossom, strawberry, cherry and red raspberry. It has flavors of pomegranate, tart cherry and red raspberry before a crisp, fruit filled finish.

title: Familie Steffen 2016 Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Ripe, rich yellow peach and grapefruit flavors hold center stage in this wine, balanced by zesty acidity and subtle earth and nut tones. It's an approachable and quaffable wine to enjoy now through 2019.

title: Finca Flichman 2015 Misterio Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This leads with jumbled plum and raspberry aromas. Its tight, intense palate is brightened by acidity and made rubbery by firm tannins. With its ripe plum and berry flavors were made for grilled steaks and chops. Just watch out for its toasty, tannic afterburn

title: Golan Heights Winery 2014 Yarden Pinot Noir (Galilee)
description: This wine proffers a bouquet of raspberry and plum with a hint of bell pepper. Bright flavors of cranberry and cherry fill the mouth and are then joined by notes of roasted tomato and bell pepper. Tannins that are not immediately apparent slide up on you and coat the gums and tongue. The bright finish is marked with a brief hint of smoke.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2015 Territory Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling, which includes some Petite Sirah and Monastrell, is still quite wound up on the nose, with aromas of slate, wet mud, berries and a bit of baking spice showing shyly. Rounded red-fruit flavors show on the sip as does that muddy clay-driven minerality, all framed by decent acid and tannins.

title: Imagery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Very fresh and very herbal in flavor, this wine smells like fresh-plucked snap peas, and tastes crisp and citrusy thanks to bright tangy acidity. It is light bodied and feels cleansing on the palate.

title: Iris Vineyards 2016 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)
description: This cool, aromatic, low-alcohol Viognier shows citrus rind and botanical scents. Lime flesh and skin flavors come through, with a core of green apple fruit. It's just underripe but well made and drinking nicely.

title: It Is What It Is! NV White (Lodi)
description: This wine tastes like a late-harvest dessert wine, and a very good one. A deep gold color and assertive nutty aromas start it off with a bang, while flavors of honey, toasted almond and caramel follow on the palate. Its texture is plush and mouthfilling and the finish lingers nicely.

title: Jean-Marc Boillot 2016  Bourgogne
description: The white Burgundy from this Pommard-based producer is classic: soft, fruity and with a crisp edge. It has attractive lemon acidity as well as a layer of ripe, juicy fruitiness. With a touch of spice at the end, it is balanced and ready to drink.

title: Keeler 2014 Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: The fruit tones in this wine—a mix of green apple, citrus and pear skin—seem to be thinning out, but a pleasant herbal component keeps it fresh. It's drinking nicely now but may peak in the next year.

title: Kooyong 2016 Clonale Chardonnay (Mornington Peninsula)
description: An interesting mix on the nose of charred greens, Band-Aid, tropical fruit and a good dollop of funk. The palate is creamy and slippery textured, with a charred oak finish. Drink now.

title: La Chouette 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: A very pretty russet shade, this offers tart rhubarb and crabapple fruit, along with wild strawberry. There's a peppery note also, and it should be enjoyed while young and at peak freshness.
